group_1.textLeft: Hehe...
The two of us are gonna form...
The Anti-Christmas Army!

group_1.textRight: What exactly does an Anti-Christmas@Army do?

group_1.textLeft: We fight! Against the Christmas Army!
You know, like in comics!
Yachiyo and the rest!
Listen up. The Christmas Army...
They're an evil group that forces everyone@to act festive!
And! The only ones who can defeat 'em@and put an end to Christmas is...
Us! The righteous Anti-Christmas Army!
Our ultimate showdown with the evil@Christmas Army will be on the 24th!
Yes! Representative Sana!

group_1.textRight: I'm pretty sure we come off as the bad@guys...

group_1.textLeft: No way! It's totally a cool name!

group_1.textRight: And I don't like fighting, or armies, or@things like that...

group_1.textLeft: I mean, it still sounds more fun than a party@though.
Heh, it's fine! I was just getting carried@away, anyways.
*Sigh* Yeah, I really can't get into this @at all!
The food'll be good...but I still don't@wanna go to a party.
Sorry, but can we just give up on shoppin'@for today?

group_1.textRight: We're not going to buy anything?

group_1.textLeft: I'm really not in the mood...
Huh?

group_1.textRight: It's my fault you're upset. I shouldn't have@brought this up...

group_1.textLeft: No, no! That's not it!
I told you... I don't like Christmas.
Sure, there's food, but I just can't get@excited for it.
So don't feel bad! Got it? Ha ha!
Anyway...
I'm over all this shoppin'. I'm just gonna go!
I'm just gonna wander around.
Hmm? Uh, the park?
Anyway, see ya!

group_1.narration: Felicia seemed cheerful, but I was worried.
She feels a different sort of trepidation@towards Christmas than I do...
It was like I could sense it...@A dark feeling, lurking deep in her heart.
I knew it was none of my business...@But it really bothered me.
The next day, I went to@Yachiyo and Iroha for advice.
